definition[0]: a period of time when a person or animal is kept apart from others in case they are carrying a disease
example[0]: The monkeys were kept in quarantine for 31 days.
definition[1]: to keep a person or animal apart from others for a period of time in case they are carrying a disease
definition[2]: when an animal or food product is kept apart from others in case it is carrying a disease, especially when it has just entered a country
example[1]: The exotic species will be kept in quarantine until health requirements are met.
example[2]: the relaxing of Britainâ€™s tough quarantine laws
